PhonebookFaculty Staff Students As PDF University Directory Search People Overview Name Search by name Title Search by title Location Search by location Apply Reset Ang Li Affiliate Assistant Professor Email: anglieceumd[.dot.]edu Phone: (301) 405-6712 Location: AVW 2365 Website: https://www.ang-li.com Google Scholar: JVKSaWIAAAAJ Twitter: angcharlesli Education: Ph.D., Duke University, 2022 Ph.D., University of Arkansas, 2018 M.E., Peking University, 2013 Appointments: CS, ECE Biography Dr. Li joined the University of Maryland, College Park as a tenure-track Assistant Professor in Aug. 2023. During the deferral time before joining, he was a research associate at Qualcomm AI Research. Dr. Li received his Ph.D. in 2022 from the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) at Duke University. Li has also earned a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Arkansas. He has an MS in Management of Innovation and Venture Capital from Peking University, and a BS in Computer Science from Henan University in China. His research interests lie in the intersection of machine learning and edge computing, with a focus on building large-scale networked and trustworthy intelligent systems to solve practical problems in a collaborative, scalable, secure, and ubiquitous manner. Dr. Li has been recognized with a variety of awards, including the IEEE TCCPS Outstanding Ph.D. Dissertation Award,Â ACM KDD Best Student Paper Award in 2020, and the 2022-2023 Duke ECE Department Outstanding Dissertation Award.
